intro: Xylobium squalens var. gracile, commonly known as the slender xylobium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has slender, wiry stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
